results.title: Going It Alone
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Filmstruck Series”.
Filmmaking has never really been studio based. John Baxter, well known Australian film historian and cinema critic, interviews some of the independents. He also takes a look at the Disney animation studio in Burbank, as well as showing us rare footage of a surrealist “Snow White” starring Betty Boop. this program is the final episode in the “Filmstruck” series which considers the impact of cinema on the social and personal life of the viewing audience.

results.title: Going home [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Cafe Productions, Sindibad Films and Omar Al-Qattan
results.brief_description: A Palestinian/UK co-production produced and directed by Palestinian born Omar Al-Qattan about the memories of a former British soldier, Major Derek Cooper, during the final days of the British abandonment of the Palestinian Arabs in their struggle against the occupying Jewish militia in Jaffa in Palestine in 1948. In the director’s words “Going Home is an attempt to pose the question of memory - whether Arab, Jewish or British - as a central issue in any dialogue which is to lead to a lasting and just peace in the region.” Through Major Cooper’s reminiscings and personal stories, the viewer is given an insight into the historical background of the Jewish Arab conflict from the years of British rule and involvement through to the Jewish immigration after WWII, the UN Partition Plan of 1947/48, the setting up of the State of Israel, the expulsion and dispossession of over three quarter million Palestinian Arabs, the battle of Jaffa and the subsequent establishment of refugee camps along the Gaza Strip and the West Bank. Also provides the Jewish and Palestinian perspectives through interviews with academics and historians, with Jews who fought with the Jewish underground militias in the battle for Jaffa and with Palestinian refugees living in the camps. Contains stills, archival and newsreel footage. In Arabic and English with English subtitles.

results.title: Going Down
results.brief_description: A searing vision of a Sydney rarely seen by tourists but one that is just below the surface. A cult hit in the past, this film has been described by Philip Adams as one of the ten best made in this country. It is the story of four young women on the town the night before one of them is travelling to New York. Their adolescence, their group, their future is breaking up. Starring Tracy Mann and David Argue.

results.title: Going all the way
results.creator_credit: PolyGram Filmed Entertainment, Lakeshore Entertainment, Tom Gorai, Sigurjon Sighvatsson and Mark Pellington
results.brief_description: Set in 1954, post-Korean War, “Going all the way” examines the personal choices of two men, both at crossroads, following discharge from the army. Sonny Burns is self-conscious, shy, sexually inexperienced and in awe of his new friend Gunner Casselman who is confident with women, but questioning his former frat-boy ways after experiencing a cultural awakening in Japan. These two men face choices that will affect them for the rest of their lives when they return to their hometown of Indianapolis but find dissatisfaction with their lot. For his part, Sonny is drawn to the sexually lascivious Gail despite his engagement to girl-next door Buddy. Casselman, who becomes interested in modernist art and is drawn to the concepts of Zen Buddhism, is attracted to an independent Jewish girl, despite the anti-Semitic ranting of his over-affectionate mother. As a coming-of-age drama “Going all the way” plods a fairly predictable path but manages some impressive flourishes, in particular its 1950s aesthetic, ably captured by cinematographer Bobby Bukowsk, and the performances of Jeremy Davies (Secretary, The Million dollar hotel) and Ben Affleck (Pearl Harbour, Good Will Hunting), the latter emitting appropriate charm. Cast includes: Lesley Ann Warren, Rachel Weisz, Rose McGowan, Jill Clayburgh, Amy Locane.

results.title: Gogodala: a cultural revival
results.brief_description: An edited version of a film by Chris Owen which examines the impact of Christianity upon the Gogodala Tribes of Western Papua New Guinea. It caused the cessation of major ceremonies and rituals, the interruption of the tribal patterns of life, and the stagnation of their art and expression. However, in 1973, with the aid of the National Cultural Council, attempts have been made towards a cultural revival, which though sometimes influenced by western and other tribal practices, has given the Gogodala a renewed sense of identity.

results.title: Goggles! (K)
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel, Weston Woods Studios and Isa Wickenhagen
results.brief_description: Peter finds a pair of motorcycle goggles without lenses. He and Archie set off with their treasure but run into some big boys who demand the goggles. Suspense mounts as Peter and Archie, with the help of Peter’s loyal dachshund, Willie, attempt to outwit the bullies. Based on the book by Ezra Jack Keats.

results.title: Goering
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Twentieth century”.
Goering’s life story. The air race of 1918; exile in Sweden; return to Germany and the early days of Nazism; Goering sets up the storm troops, the Gestapo, the Luftwaffe, is largely responsible for the economic revival of Germany and wins immense popular prestige. Early Luftwaffe triumphs are eclipsed by the failure of operation Sea Lion and the RAAF raids on Germany. Goering falls from power and public prestige to a figurehead. His capture, trial and sentence at Nuremberg.

results.title: Godzilla: king of the monsters
results.creator_credit: Tomoyuki Tanaka, Galaxy Films, Ishiro Honda and Terry Morse
results.brief_description: Nuclear weapon testing resurrects a relic from the Jurassic age, Godzilla, and the creature is heading for Japan. This is the story that American reporter Steve Martin (Raymond Burr), is investigating. He is hot on the trail of a series of mysterious disasters off the coast of Japan, which leads him to Godzilla. Godzilla wreaks havoc over Tokyo nights, leaving death and destruction in its wake. Dr Serizawa discovers a weapon that will mean the end of Godzilla, but Japan will have to pay a high price; the annihilation of Tokyo Bay. Originally released in Japan as ‘Gojira’ (1954), this version inserted scenes with Raymond Burr. Based on the long running series created by Inoshiro Honda.
